alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 09 at 8:33AM ChST until January 11 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: Updated to refine affected reefs for High Surf Advisory ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 AM CHST THURSDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 9 feet, along with dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...High surf along north facing reefs and high risk of rip currents along north and east facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...From 6 AM Wednesday to 6 AM ChST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North facing reefs may experience this sooner as a northern swell may come in quicker than expected.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
